result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy Husband

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy Husband in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Jeremy Husband.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin.
Case in court status conference. Parties is awaiting additional discovery and requests a status date. Court grants requests. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Motion to Preserve Evidence

Defendant Jeremy Husband in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense received offer and discovery and requested more time for defendant to review discovery.  Court grants defense request.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Jeremy Husband in court with Attorney Jade K Hall.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Judge Franke. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.   
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 608 Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with Y.R.C., M.T.R. and B.J.R.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jeremy Husband in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Jeremy Husband in custody. Nate McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense a sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4).
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
